title: Internationalization (i18n) for the app
description:
Set up full internationalization support for the application.

## Overview
Enable the app to support multiple languages and locales. RAC components already support i18n via I18nProvider (set up in qd3.1), this epic covers the rest of the app.

## Scope

### Infrastructure
- Choose i18n library (react-i18next, next-intl, or similar)
- Set up translation file structure
- Configure locale detection (browser, URL, user preference)
- Add locale switcher UI

### Content Translation
- Extract hardcoded strings to translation keys
- Create translation files for supported locales
- Handle pluralization and interpolation

### Number/Date/Currency Formatting
RAC provides @internationalized/number for locale-aware number handling:
- **NumberFormatter** - Format numbers to locale-specific strings
- **NumberParser** - Parse locale-specific strings back to numbers
- Supports: decimals, percentages, currency, units
- Handles Latin, Arabic, and Han numbering systems
- Tiny bundle (1.7 kB with Brotli)
- Used internally by RAC NumberField

Date/time formatting via @internationalized/date (RAC DatePicker, DateField)

### Technical Considerations
- SSR/SSG support with TanStack Start
- URL-based locale routing (e.g., /en/dashboard, /fr/dashboard)
- Fallback locale handling
- TypeScript support for translation keys
- Bundle optimization (load only needed locale)

## Supported Locales (Initial)
- en-US (English - default)
- (Add more as needed)

## Dependencies
- qd3.1: RAC I18nProvider setup (foundation)

## References
- RAC I18nProvider: https://react-aria.adobe.com/I18nProvider
- RAC Internationalization: https://react-aria.adobe.com/internationalization
- @internationalized/number: https://react-aria.adobe.com/internationalized/number
- @internationalized/date: https://react-aria.adobe.com/internationalized/date

title: Evaluate replacing specialized UI packages with RAC
description:
Evaluate whether to replace specialized UI packages with react-aria-components equivalents.

## Current Specialized Packages

| Package | Component | RAC Alternative | Notes |
|---------|-----------|-----------------|-------|
| sonner | sonner.tsx | RAC Toast | Evaluate feature parity |
| react-day-picker | calendar.tsx | RAC Calendar/DatePicker | RAC has full date system |
| vaul | drawer.tsx | RAC Modal (slide) | Vaul has mobile gestures |
| cmdk | command.tsx | RAC ComboBox + custom | cmdk is specialized |
| input-otp | input-otp.tsx | Custom with RAC | Specialized OTP input |
| embla-carousel | carousel.tsx | None | Keep embla |
| recharts | chart.tsx | None | Keep recharts |
| react-resizable-panels | resizable.tsx | None | Keep panels |

## Evaluation Criteria
- Feature parity with current implementation
- Bundle size impact
- Accessibility improvements
- Maintenance burden reduction
- Breaking changes to consumers

## Low Priority
These are working well with specialized packages. Only migrate if:
- Package becomes unmaintained
- RAC offers significant improvements
- Reducing dependencies is a priority

title: Evaluate RAC Calendar/DatePicker vs react-day-picker
description:
Evaluate whether RAC Calendar/DatePicker can replace react-day-picker.

## Current: react-day-picker
- Full calendar component
- Date range selection
- Customizable styling
- Locale support

## RAC Calendar/DatePicker
- Calendar, RangeCalendar
- DatePicker, DateRangePicker
- DateField (keyboard input)
- Full internationalization
- Accessible by default

### @internationalized/date Foundation
RAC date components are powered by @internationalized/date:
- **CalendarDate** - Date without time, tied to specific calendar
- **CalendarDateTime** - Date + time without timezone
- **ZonedDateTime** - Date + time + timezone
- **Time** - Clock time independent of date
- **Calendar** - Interface for calendar system conversions

Key capabilities:
- 13 calendar systems (Gregorian, Buddhist, Islamic, Persian, etc.)
- Date arithmetic and field manipulation
- Cross-calendar and timezone conversion
- Locale-specific metadata queries
- 8 kB bundle (2.8 kB tree-shaken for basic use)

## Potential Benefits
- Unified date/time system
- Better keyboard navigation
- Integrated with RAC ecosystem
- Remove external dependency
- Far more comprehensive i18n (13 calendars vs limited locale)

## Evaluation Points
- [ ] Feature comparison
- [ ] Styling flexibility
- [ ] Bundle size difference
- [ ] Migration effort
- [ ] Breaking changes

## References
- @internationalized/date: https://react-aria.adobe.com/internationalized/date

title: Evaluate RAC Modal vs vaul drawer
description:
Evaluate whether RAC Modal with animations can replace vaul drawer.

## Current: vaul
- Mobile-friendly drawer
- Swipe gestures
- Snap points
- iOS-like feel

## RAC Modal
- Accessible modal/dialog
- No built-in gestures
- Would need custom animation

## Likely Outcome
Keep vaul - the gesture support and mobile UX is its main value. RAC Modal doesn't provide swipe-to-dismiss or snap points.

## Evaluation Points
- [ ] Gesture requirements
- [ ] Mobile UX comparison
- [ ] Can RAC + framer-motion match vaul?

description:
Migrate form select and slider components from @base-ui/react to react-aria-components.

Files to migrate:

  - Requires composition: Select > Button > Popover > ListBox > ListBoxItem
- slider.tsx: Slider → RAC Slider (easy)
- progress.tsx: Progress → RAC ProgressBar (easy)
- **input.tsx: Input → RAC TextField (easy)**
- **textarea.tsx: → RAC TextField with multiline (easy)**

Note: RAC TextField handles both input and textarea via the `inputElementType` prop or by using TextArea component.
